Sempat Tembak Polisi, 3 Tersangka Kasus Narkoba di Thailand Kabur
06 Nov 2019, 12:32 by Novi Christiastuti
Bangkok - Tiga tersangka kasus narkoba di Thailand kabur dari pengadilan setempat setelah menembak dan menikam polisi yang mengawal mereka. Ketiga tersangka yang salah satunya warga negara Amerika Serikat (AS) itu lalu kabur dengan menumpang sebuah truk pikap.
Seperti dilansir AFP dan Channel News Asia, Selasa (6/11/2019), ketiga tersangka itu masih dalam pengejaran sekitar lebih dari 24 jam setelah melarikan diri dari salah satu ruang tahanan di pengadilan Pattaya pada Senin (4/11) waktu setempat.
Otoritas setempat masih terus menyisir kawasan pantai Pattaya, yang berjarak dua jam perjalanan dari Bangkok.
"Jika mereka melawan... otoritas setempat harus mengambil tindakan tegas," ucap juru bicara Kepolisian Nasional Thailand, Krissana Pattanacharoen, dalam pernyataannya.
Media lokal Bangkok Post yang mengutip dokumen pengadilan menyebut ketiga tersangka itu bernama Bart Allen Helmus yang seorang warga AS, kemudian Sirinapa Wisetrit yang warga Thailand dan istri dari Helmus, dan Noi Nilthes yang warga Thailand.
Pasangan pria AS dan wanita Thailand itu terancam hukuman mati atas dakwaan perdagangan narkoba yang menjerat mereka. Meskipun diketahui bahwa vonis mati jarang dieksekusi di Thailand.

Had Shot Police, 3 Suspects of Drug Cases in Thailand Escape
Nov 6 2019, 12:32 by Novi Christiastuti
Bangkok - Three drug case suspects in Thailand escaped from the local court after shooting and stabbing the police who were escorting them. The three suspects, one of whom was a citizen of the United States (US), then fled in a pickup truck.
As reported by AFP and Channel News Asia, Tuesday (11/06/2019), the three suspects are still in pursuit about more than 24 hours after escaping from one of the detention rooms in the Pattaya court on Monday (4/11) local time.
Local authorities continue to comb the Pattaya beach area, which is two hours away from Bangkok.
"If they oppose ... local authorities must take decisive action," Thai National Police spokesman Krissana Pattanacharoen said in a statement.
Local media in the Bangkok Post, quoting court documents, named the three suspects as Bart Allen Helmus, a US citizen, then Sirinapa Wisetrit, a Thai citizen and wife of Helmus, and Noi Nilthes, a Thai citizen.
The pair of US men and Thai women face the death penalty for drug trafficking charges that ensnared them. Although it is known that death sentences are rarely executed in Thailand.
